description: Number of ways of writing n as an unordered sum of at most 3 nonzero triangular numbers.
comments: Fermat asserted that every number is the sum of three triangular numbers. This was proved by Gauss, who recorded in his Tagebuch entry for Jul 10 1796 that: EYPHEKA! num = DELTA + DELTA + DELTA.a(n) <= A167618(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 07 2009
